Examples of chaperon include all except?
questions.explanation:
Correct Answer (CE)

Explanation:

  • • Explanation: Chaperone proteins
  • • Present in prokaryotes as well as eukaryotes Induced by heat, stress or acidosis Bind to hydrophobic regions of unfolded and aggregated proteins and act as a quality control or editing mechanism for detecting misfolded proteins Most show ATPase activity Found in cytosol, mitochondria and endoplasmic reticulum lumen Examples include Heat shock proteins, Calnexin, calreticulin, BiP, GRP94, PDI, PPI
  • • Present in prokaryotes as well as eukaryotes
  • • Induced by heat, stress or acidosis
  • • Bind to hydrophobic regions of unfolded and aggregated proteins and act as a quality control or editing mechanism for detecting misfolded proteins
  • • Most show ATPase activity
  • • Found in cytosol, mitochondria and endoplasmic reticulum lumen
  • • Examples include Heat shock proteins, Calnexin, calreticulin, BiP, GRP94, PDI, PPI

questions.text: Vitamin K in its coenzyme form is regenerated by which enzyme?
Vitamin E deficiency in adult causes?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Neuromuscular problems – such as spinocerebellar ataxia and myopathies. Neurological problems – may include dysarthria, absence of deep tendon reflexes, loss of the ability to sense vibration and detect where body parts are in three dimensional space, and positive Babinski sign. Hemolyticanemia – due to oxidative damage to red blood cells Retinopathy Impairment of the immune response
  • • Neuromuscular problems – such as spinocerebellar ataxia and myopathies.
  • • Neurological problems – may include dysarthria, absence of deep tendon reflexes, loss of the ability to sense vibration and detect where body parts are in three dimensional space, and positive Babinski sign.
  • • Hemolyticanemia – due to oxidative damage to red blood cells
  • • Retinopathy
  • • Impairment of the immune response

questions.text: Identify the phenomenon shown below?
Best investigation for metabolic disorder is?
Vitamin C deficiency is associated with?
questions.explanation:
Correct Answer (ABCE)

Explanation:

  • • Explanation: Features of Vitamin C deficiency (Scurvy)
  • • Constitutional symptoms: Low grade fever, malaise, irritability, weakness, low appetite, weight loss Gum bleeds, petechiae, ecchymosis and perifollicular hemorrhages Epistaxis Anemia Defective dentition Poor wound healing Low immunity Scorbutic rosary: Tender Brittle bones Generalised tenderness and pseudoparalysis in young children
  • • Constitutional symptoms: Low grade fever, malaise, irritability, weakness, low appetite, weight loss
  • • Gum bleeds, petechiae, ecchymosis and perifollicular hemorrhages
  • • Epistaxis
  • • Anemia
  • • Defective dentition
  • • Poor wound healing
  • • Low immunity
  • • Scorbutic rosary: Tender
  • • Brittle bones
  • • Generalised tenderness and pseudoparalysis in young children

questions.text: Full form of LCAT is -
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Lecithin–cholesterol acyltransferase (LCAT, also called phosphatidylcholine–sterol O-acyltransferase) is an enzymethat converts free cholesterol into cholesteryl ester (a more hydrophobic form of cholesterol), which is then sequestered into the core of a lipoprotein particle.
  • • Lecithin–cholesterol acyltransferase (LCAT, also called phosphatidylcholine–sterol O-acyltransferase) is an enzymethat converts free cholesterol into cholesteryl ester (a more hydrophobic form of cholesterol), which is then sequestered into the core of a lipoprotein particle.

Which among the following fragments will be found maximally towards the negative pole during DNA gel electrophoresis?
questions.explanation:

  • • DNA itself is negatively charged and when gel electrophoresis is done, the largest fragment will move most slowly and hence will be found maximally towards the negative side.
